intro: Strophium, commonly known as water dropwort, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apiaceae. It typically features slender, erect stems and small, greenish or white flowers arranged in umbels. The leaves are usually narrow and have a distinctive, slightly hairy texture. The plant is often found in moist or wet habitats, such as marshes and stream banks. It is characterized by its aromatic foliage and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
